Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a dark-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is brown in section, the interior is slightly ribbed and partially covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of six lines of black-painted demotic text, the third of which is underscored, and one line of impressed cord-marked decoration.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393778) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393778)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.11)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 11 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
